storyInfo: Thiago attempts to convince Jordi to leave, and tells him about the truth of Gran Faro. The dark sea leaves no way out.

attributes.content: Jordi!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Uncle Thiago? What's going on?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Quick, pack up. We have to go.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Wait, what? Where are we going?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The Inquisition is coming.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The cultists, the monsters from the sea...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Are we leaving this town for good?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: We?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No, no, just you. When the Inquisition finds out there are cultists here, the Ægir will be their first target.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I don't care what happens to the cultists, or even the rest of us... We've lived here too long. We don't know how to live anywhere else.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But you're different. You've always wanted to see the world outside. You're young and talented.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But, I... this is all so sudden.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's an opportunity for change, lad. Your last chance. Be brave.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Even if you somehow survive the Inquisition's interrogation, all that's waiting for you here is a life spent in fear of the ocean and the Sea Terrors.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: If you leave, though, your fate will finally be in your own hands. Not stuck in that little chapel.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: That place is too small for you. You shouldn't just—
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But, I... It's so sudden.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: There's no time to hesitate, lad. You must be strong, like your parents and their parents before them.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Did my parents really give their lives for Iberia?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: We don't have time for this. Come, we must pack.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: It's been so long since we've had a traveling trader stop by... all your clothes are so old. You can buy new ones so easily out there. All the more reason to leave, don't you think?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But why would the Inquisition be looking for Ægir? Couldn't cultists just as well be Liberi or Feline?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Ægir come from the sea, same as the monsters and the disaster.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Wait... have you seen them?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No, I... I mean, Uncle, you knew? You knew they were here?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yes... we all knew there was something to the rumors.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Juan was one of them. He went into an empty warehouse to hide from the streets. He was hurt, and... he had no hostility towards me.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Right, because you're Ægir. I know they've gone mad, that they're not normal.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But why? ...Are you sheltering them?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: None of that matters anymore. You'll be leaving soon.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No, I don't want to.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I... I was born here in Gran Faro. If I run away just to hide from the Inquisition, I... I don't know.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You what? Do you have any idea what you're saying?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No Ægir has ever made it back in one piece after the Inquisition gets them! If you're LUCKY, you might return missing a few body parts, or maybe your sanity.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Most simply disappear though. Some say they've been imprisoned, others that they've been executed. No one comes back! No one!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The Inquisition will burn everything to the ground in their 'mercy,' before the monsters and cultists even get a chance. Nothing cleanses like fire!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: U-Uncle Thiago, calm down!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The angry old man sees in Jordi the shadow of himself, arriving in this land all those years ago, hoping to construct a new garden out of the ruins.
Decades have passed, and those who were once young are no longer so. Yet what have they built in Gran Faro? What has become of Iberia?
Their efforts have done nothing to change the tidings of fate, and the home that they put so much of their passion into now stands on the precipice of collapse.
A vast helplessness engulfs Thiago, like the dark clouds over the sea.
No one...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No one... no one has ever come back. Not Marin, not anyone else. Gran Faro is already burning. Be it the Inquisition or the monsters, there's no future for us here.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Uncle Thiago...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll never be able to face your parents if anything happens to you, Jordi.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I... I know, I...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: C-Can I go see the ocean?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Gaaaaaaaah!
attributes.name: Tight-Lipped Adherent

attributes.content: Dream now, and may your sleep be full of nightmares.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Leave them to me, Kal'tsit. Soon enough, they will confess where their dark and dank schemes take root.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: No doubt.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: (Wow, the old man's with you, Doctor?)
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: You are... Alive Until Sunset. A rock band. I must admit I don't understand these new-fangled trends.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Have faith in the divinity of song then.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Iberia hasn't recorded a direct sighting of a Feranmut for centuries, much less an interaction. If your music represents your views on human society, then that would certainly pique my interest.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We haven't paid attention to that sort of thing since 'Deep Color in the Sea.' It's a topic that's all too familiar, you see.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Ha... I wonder, what music would you put to Iberia? The most surprising thing I've found at my age is how much still surprises me.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: As we discussed, the Inquisition will prepare a means for you to travel to the Eye of Iberia as soon as possible, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You will eliminate any obstacles in your path.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...That Sea Terror. The one that's embedded in the guy.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: There's the scent of an Ægir on it. A different scent though, one more like us. The scent of the sea.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Thiago's steps are small, but quick. He seems burdened by age, yet surprisingly energetic.
It was all Jordi could do to keep up with his pace. He said he wanted to see the ocean.
He did not know why he said that. Even now, he does not know whether it is he who wants to see it, or Thiago.
'I'm an Ægir,' Jordi thinks. 'The sea is my home.'
'But how do I breathe down there? How did my ancestors live underwater?'
Questions pop into his head one after another, questions he had been curious about from a young age. But Thiago is Liberi, and cannot answer his questions.

attributes.text: The Ægir came from the ocean. Why would they drown in the ocean?

attributes.content: The sea...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: When was the last time I saw it?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If the Penal Battalion were still here, they would've taken us in for questioning by now.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: S-Sorry for asking to do this.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...It's fine.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Look at the coastline. Barren and decrepit. Decades ago, we had big dreams of building an impregnable fortress here.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Today, there's a Penal Battalion outpost several clicks to the northeast, and another on the cliffs to the west.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Everything else? A lie... or perhaps a dream in the true sense. Reality is before our eyes, reminding us that the old Iberia will never return.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago whistles. Jordi rarely sees him do so.
A change seems to have come over the normally gloomy mayor, turning him into a young worker once again, passionate about building his home.
Tsk, it's all in the past. We failed. Gran Faro is the final resting place of our failures.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You mentioned your parents, didn't you lad?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I did...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't remember much of the ocean. Everyone talks about Ægir and the Islanders, but none of it feels real. I was born on land.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Aye. Your parents, or more accurately your grandparents, came from a place called Ægir, a great country deep beneath the ocean.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: That's where you were from, lad.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Ægir.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Years ago, the dream we had for Gran Faro wasn't the lifeless town you see today. It would have been a fortress, one that laughs at any siege.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We would have built defenses on the coast around it, protected our country from calamity, heralded her revival, and rebuilt our home. All with our own hands.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We really thought so.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Jordi does not interrupt. Thiago grows increasingly excited, a light returning to his dull and cloudy eyes.
Every hair on his body stands on end. He changes his posture. The sea breeze brushes against his brow, and he even looks grander somehow.
The last step of our grand design, spanning half a century, was to return to the Eye of Iberia and relight the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The lighthouse?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: A relic of the Golden Age, spared from destruction by the Profound Silence.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Not even calamity could break us. We marched ever forward, our hearts filled with hope.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Marin wore that blue hat of hers. She said we'd become heroes, that our names would live on.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Your grandparents, your parents... two generations of Gran Faro gave everything they had for this blueprint. Their greatness should have been immortalized forever.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But now there's nothing left.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You see that ship? There used to be many ships at the port. The Penal Battalion should have taken it, but they've forgotten all about it.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: All that's left is some junk, a town out in the middle of nowhere, more troubles than I can count, people stuck in a dead end, and—
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: And that ship.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yes. That ship.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: My parents, and the grandparents I've never met... were they proud of their duty?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This isn't the first time you've asked that.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You asked it when you first learned to talk, and when you started working at the chapel. You asked it many times, pointing at the dust-covered notebooks and schematics at home.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I... I remember.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yes, lad.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No matter how many times you ask, my answer is always 'yes.' No matter the outcome, they never lost hope after that great disaster, and gave their all to the cause.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Your parents even volunteered for our final attempt to reach the Eye.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Don't blame them for abandoning you. They were carrying what was left of all our dreams. So many years had come and gone. We HAD to succeed.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The last we saw of them was when their fleet set sail from right here.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: They were heroes. Marin said we would all become heroes, but now none of us are, except for the dead.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: So my father and mother...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But you know what laid waste to it all? In the midst of despair, we managed to muster the hope to relight the lighthouse. And what came of it?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The Inquisition. They arrested the Ægir. They said there were Church of the Deep spies among us.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We were fighting for Iberia, but the Inquisition took everything from us—our pride, our dignity, our dreams... everything.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Do you understand now?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Leave this hopeless town, leave Iberia and go as far as you can. Go to another country, go to a better place.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: There's nothing left here, in Gran Faro.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The sea!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: This is the wrong way. Are we just gonna leave our instruments in that damp room?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: No, I can smell the waves. The sea is just ahead.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: What do waves smell like?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Like cotton.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: Using olfactory vocabulary to express visual elements...
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: But you're right. The sea's right up ahead.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: An Ægir, and of a different breed from the ones who grew up on land. You must be that strange sort of Ægir.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: What did they call you again? Oh right, Abyssal Hunters.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Gladiia frowns. She rarely expresses her emotions in such complex ways.
It came from her instincts as an Abyssal Hunter, as a Consul, as an Ægir technician, as a soldier.
You are... AUS.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You know them.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Yes, by chance.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Why so mysterious? Well, whatever, I'm just glad our name is known even among the Ægir.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Alty once visited that ship, following your scent trail. But this is the first time we've met in person.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I'm Aya, main vocalist of AUS. Dan here is our drummer.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Greetings, guests from the sea.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: You're of the sea too. A pleasure to meet you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: When I came to the land, I sought Kal'tsit to learn more about you—about your terrestrial kin.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Oh... if you're talking about the things on land, then I guess we're kin, technically. Not sure I can say the same about the ones in the sea.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: What are you here for? The doctor?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Just an appointment.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We seek a way back to Ægir.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Back to Ægir, huh... The three of you, together?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: We are not so easily separated.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Aw, what a great friendship. What about the one in the back? Is she shy? Why doesn't she say anything?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Something doesn't seem right with her. Her brain is tormented. Is she sick?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: You could say so.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Poor thing.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: —Mm!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: What is it, Dan?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I just felt something up my spine. Like an electric shock to my brain, then a strange—
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: —Voice.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Unusually quiet, Specter gazes at the sky.
She closes her eyes. Waves brush against chaotic thoughts. This place is far from the coast, but something is touching her consciousness.
It is in the wind, among the clouds, through the land, from the sea.
A voice. I can hear it.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hmm... I don't hear anything.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The music of the sea. The children of the sea are crying.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: It is... a song.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The scent of Sea Terrors. Lots of them. The town is under attack.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: H-Hey! How did you get in here?
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: A-Are you an Inquisitor?! The ones you're dragging are—
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Go home.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: These two are under suspicion of colluding with heretics. I am performing my duty as an Iberian Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Leave now, unless you want to be caught up in battle. Their blood will draw enemies.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: A-An Inquisitor?! When did the Inquisition arrive? W-Were those outsiders your informants?
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: I, I'm not a cultist! I don't have anything to do with those guys!
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: Do you know these two?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Them? Juan...? It's Juan? I always thought he looked suspicious. He—
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: That's enough.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: No need to torment yourself. Go home, and be sure your doors and windows are locked.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: A-Alright...
attributes.name: Panicking Townsperson

attributes.content: You can come out now.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: An Inquisitor... no, a High Inquisitor!
attributes.name: Church of the Deep Cultist A

attributes.content: What's the Inquisition doing here?
attributes.name: Church of the Deep Cultist B

attributes.content: Amaia and Thiago have gone missing. Do the Ægir have something to do with it?
attributes.name: Church of the Deep Cultist A

attributes.content: You killed Juan, you bastard!
attributes.name: Church of the Deep Cultist B

attributes.content: Not quite, he yet lives. I intend to extract some answers from him.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You are different from the enemies I know. Your minds are your own, and you are working under clear directions.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But if you're truly sane and awake, then you should understand—
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: —That you stand no chance against me, nor any other brave soldier of the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Tch...
attributes.name: Church of the Deep Cultist A

attributes.content: Why give up your lives? What meaning is there in your futile sacrifice?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What have the accursed tides promised you? What are you scheming on this barren shore?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I have many questions, enemies of Iberia.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: And I can only hope your god has answers.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen
